welcome ladies and gents to a review that is made based entirely of my own opinion, if you don't like hearing the opinions of others please do move along because this isn't the review for you... but now that i think about it, if that were the case then no reviews would be for you since all reviews has some kind of personal attachment from the person who wrote it. Now let us get started shall we?
So unlike many people here, i didn't watch fairy tail from the beginning, I hadn't even heard of it up until 11 days before the 2014 version was meantto air. Intrigued by the premise of the series as well as it's infamous reputation for excessive fan service, i decided to watch the original season and finished it just in time to watch season 02 (2014 version) which i have been watching weekly since then.


now on to the actual review shall we?


the story:


so this is your basic shounen story that has a story but never really sticks to it however there is both good and bad to be found in that. the bad being that it can get tiresome fast if you've seen many shounen anime, it get's repetitive at some points and the often used "nakama power-ups" does kill some of the enjoyment, but in saying that, there is also an upside to this. if you're looking for something that has great comedy (at times), or you want to watch something that will make you want to break whatever viewing method you use to watch anime or even if you just want to be hit in the feels, then fairy tail has it all for you and in droves!! also not forgetting the often used "the girls are hot so lets put them in fan service situations" trope and you're pretty much good to go.


now for those who might say, "well yeah so what? i hate fairy tail because the original story was natsu looking for his father"... uh... yeah NO! fairy tail was meant to chronicle the life and times of lucy heartfelia and her time in fairy tail! I would like to say right now that i believe that at the true end of fairy tail, we're going to find out it was nothing more than lucy reading a penned down version of events that she did after she became an accomplished author, to her daughter (probably named lalya).


but then you might say "well there are other shounen that stick to the plot" well yeah, you can say that! but just as there are anime that stick to it's premise, there are those that don't. like seriously, at least everything that happens in fairy tail is about fairy tail, what about dragonball/z/super? named after the thing that is meant to be it's central plot and was aptly said plot during the first half of dragonball but then became nothing but a trope to raise the dead in later episodes/seasons.


moving on...


so the arcs withing 2014 were a hit and miss with some people. for example, i liked most of the celestial spirits filler arc while many didn't. likewise other people felt the same about the other arcs. what the arcs do present though are a little backstory to some characters, a little fleshing out of some characters as well as an emotional hit through nostalgia


[spoiler]testing testing, did this spoiler work?


i hate doing reviews of series that are ongoing, you know why? because people complain about shit that didn't happen at the time that happened later on in said series. and if it's the reason they scored it low, even more so to avoid said reviews until it's updated after completion.  --> many complained about natsu losing his way about finding his father, well news flash and massive SPOILER, NATSU FINDS IGNEEL TOWARDS THE LATER PART OF FAIRY TAIL 2014[/spoiler]


and now the characters:


i will not explain a lot here, why? because 2014 is not a reboot, it's a continuation of where the 2009 version stopped before it went on hiatus during the grand magic games arc, which means if you're reading this review, you've already watched the first 175 episodes and are considering whether or not to follow up by watching the 2014 variant. With that being the case, you already know everything you need to know about the characters by now and if you don't, what were you paying attention too? there's no characters introduced in the 2014 version that are of any relevance and those that are were here prior to the 2014 airing.


now the art:


one thing people complained about a lot was the new art style, it lacked colours (it was visually dark) and the characters don't look as good as they did before, well i choose to disagree.


firstly while i do not hold anything against those who have an opinion of whether something was to their liking or not, i do have a problem with people who complain that this is how "it should've been done" really? like really? those who have the necessary qualifications for the animation industry aside, most people who complain actually know nothing about actual animation and their processes, yet they think that what was done was wrong? seriously? hey i can understand not liking it, but many who complained are those whose alternative is black and white static images with no sound so wouldn't any animation be better than no animation?


the character designs look more like their source material designs and the dark shadows used i feel are more than suited for the darker arcs seen in 2014, so yeah i won't say any more than that because i'm not qualified in the field of animation and i would be a hypocrite if i said things that aren't factual.



the sound:


best part! the openings and endings were memorable, the OST never fails to hit the right note and induce emotions more readily in certain situations whether that be laughter or tears. it fits in well with what the series portrays and that's about all i'm saying on the matter.



overall:


watch it if you want to continue the story of fairy tail but don't want to take to reading the manga. it has the same vibe that fairy tail always had so whether that's your cup of tea is for you to decide.

I absolutely love Fairy Tail. I have been watching it since 2014 version came out wish i had been there since the very beginning but what can i say. The newest episodes are starting to come along and you can see things happening similarly or differently than they did with the manga. I can not wait for the next few episodes they are going to bring a lot of tears and feels along with them.

Fairy Tail is one of the big anime who most people around the world, know about it. This show is hated by many people and loved by the most fans. Fairy Tail season 1, for me, was fine but, season 2, I think, it's better. I am writing this review based on my personal opinion.
THIS REVIEW MAY CONTAIN SOME SPOILERS!!!
STORY ( 7/10 )
I think the story is better than the first season. The appearances of the dragons, stronger dark guilds and the story of first guild master Mavis were very good for the plot. I liked how they continue the Grand Magic Games and howthey end it with the win of Fairy Tail. They showed some of the backstory of Zeref which I find it, a very good idea for the plot. What I didn't like so much was the Sun Village arc and the power of friendship who make Fairy Tail win every fight.


 CHARACATER ( 7/10 )


Well, the characters were good enough, I think. Natsu is the same as in first season with the exception that he is stronger. He remains an hyperactive person who wants to fight every enemy he meets and who cares for his friends, a lot!! Lucy is more stronger, getting all the celestial spirits and she is capable to fight with every opponent. I liked the character development of Gray. They made him very strong which made him cool. He doesn't stop to get undressed though. Erza remains the same as in the first season.

Generally, they remain the same as in the first season with the only difference that they are stronger.


ART ( 8/10 )


The animation was a lot better than the first season. They have shown more blood, which I find it a good point. The shapes of the characters and the colors improved a lot. The fights were, also, good. The new moves and new magic of the characters were a lot better.


SOUND ( 10/10 )


I think that the music is the best in what Fairy Tail can offer. The openings songs are great such as the endings. The OSTs are very pleasantly. Some of their songs are my favorites. Every soundtrack was very suitable for its scene. The voice actors were, also, good.


ENJOYMENT ( 8/10 )


I think this season was better than the previous one in all the categories. I enjoyed a lot and was worth it to watch it and kill my time with it. The comedy and the drama were good. The adventure was great. So, I think is a good anime.


OVERALL ( 8/10 )

Fairy Tail is one of those animes you would truly love deep in your heart. Its a anime that's very easy to understand and is very good anime to watch as a beginner. You get that feeling of excitement and entertainment. Each character has their own back story and is very interesting to see each characters back story.
Character: All the characters are easy to understand, they all have different personality. If your into comedy then you should watch Fairy Tail. They all will make you laugh and they also inspire you, possibly even change your personality. They all treat each other like family and itmakes you wish you were a part of Fairy Tail.




Story: The story is very easy to understand. Everytime  you watch a episode you just desperately want to watch the next episode to see what happens the story. You get to excited you might forget to do something you were supposed to do in real life or be late to a appointment. 



Overall the anime I would rate a 10/10.Deep in my heart I know Fairy Tail is one of my favorite animes.It could even be your new favorite anime too. Since people don't like reading I'll cut it from hear. Are you still fired up?

Spoiler Free: 
To start this review off, I want to exclaim that Fairy Tail 2014 is not a good anime. This will cause many looking at this review to wonder why I gave it such a high review then. To address your question its high rating is solely based on the fact I view the show as more of a guilty pleasure, something that I can unwind and just enjoy the fights, great music/ops, and simple story. In many cases, I watched Fairy Tail when I had a long day and just wanted to have fun. The show has shown an adherent ability to makethe watchers feel emotions and it is just what you need to get you out of a slump. To this, I recommend the show as something you go into not expecting an extremely plot-driven story with thousands of loopholes that make you think for years.


To add if you have already watched the first series there are some issues that pop up in this sequel unlike its original. To credit the original Fairy Tail it had amazing art and animation, sadly this sequel is far from it. For this series, the production studio changed and it is very noticeable, the show looks darker and a lot of the scenes just look terribly drawn.


The music is as amazing as always and in my opinion, some of the intros are even better than in the original. My favorite op being the opening for the Zero/Mavis flashback arc. The osts in the episodes also amazing and fit many of the scenes pretty well but music can really be opinion based.


The story takes place right where the prequel left it, unlike the prequel is fails at pacing. The at many times felt like it was standing still in the same area for multiple episodes. This is best seen in the extremely long Tataros arc even though it was only 21 episodes long. It felt as if it could be cut down to 16 or so with ease but that all goes down to the production studio and those who want to milk the show for all they can.


My last note is the characters, I felt the charters at many points made great strides. Their personalities haven't changed but their mindset at times has become noticeably different. *Spoiler Territory* Natsu showed that he has come to term with moving on following Igneels death, making a resolution that he has to get stronger to protect everyone and destroy acnologia.  Gray experienced meeting his father again just to lose him in a very similar manner to Natsu, instead of blabbering he gained the resolution to take on his father's mission of defeating END even if it meant fighting with Natsu at the time. There were some other examples with Jellal and Erza but I think you get the point.


Otherwise, I feel there isn't much to cover with this review that others haven't. Hopefully, this review is helpful to anyone planning on watching Fairy Tail 2014 or anyone looking to reaffirm their viewpoint. To anyone reading this have a nice day.

I loved Fairy Tail 2014, even though it did get repetitive at times with the whole "oh natsu is mad, someone targets the guild and hurts a member and then the whole guild bands together to destroy the enemy" yes it was a repetitive cycle. However the character development and the new characters are what made this anime so interesting.We can all tell that Natsu was definitely getting stronger but not just him, you saw development in other characters like Gray, Erza, Lucy and even Gajeel, and Levi. You saw them grow and as the anime progressed you started to build a stronger connection with them. 


Compared to the first Fairy Tail, in Fairy Tail 2014 i loved the arcs. The grand magic games was my favorite one and then the Dragon one. I loved the different arcs that this season gave. You also get to see more in depth about the characters background story *SPOLIER* like gray with his father, or Lucy and her family. 


Overall enjoyment for this i give it a 9 because you get a little bit of everything. You can cry, laugh, get anger, etc its like a roller coaster of emotions this season. The battles are well point together, i feel like their more crisp than the first season. The characters (old and new) will make you love them even more when you follow their journey. Personally I enjoyed the entire anime, I'm really sad to see it end. But their always the manga. But Fairy tail will always have a close spot in my heart <3

Fairy 2014 is the second series of anime based off the popular manga Fairy Tail written by Hiro Mashima and continues where the original anime left off. But how well does this adaptation hold up compared to its predecessor...
Pretty damn well actually, with a new animation studio (the one that did the Fairy Tail Movie which was decent) and new material to create this version is pretty much equal to the original.
Story: The one thing that I notice many have issue with this adaptation is where it starts off which is the second part of The Grand Magic Games Arc which wasn't well recieved inany of the versions produced. However, I found that the anime tried to make the arc enjoyable with its stellar animation quality and awesome character moments (+ fan-service if your into that sort of thing...). The whole future subplot is kinda annoying and unnecessary at times but as someone who enjoyed the arc in the manga I understand that liking it is a minority opinion. The second arc - Eclipse Celestial Spirits - is an anime only version which is rather bad and boring for the second arc of the anime but their are some funny moments that made me laugh but the writing was never really polished or the 'fights' were rather basic but I knew that they were saving all of their talent for the next part of the anime - Taratarous. This Arc was perhaps one of the most beautiful, well  acted and emotional parts of any Fairy Tail season produced. The Arc didn't shy away from some of the darker themes (such as torture) or even character deaths as not only villains but good guys died to (I won't spoil who). All characters were involved and had something to do with a few members from the other guilds making an appearance. Finally, the anime ended with Fairy Tail Zero which is 10 episodes of the origin of Fairy Tail and its first master Mavis Vermillion (who is so adorable) and the other two were the set up episodes for a new journey staring Natsu, Lucy and Happy. The arc was obvious filler for the show as they need to allow the manga to get ahead in order to start producing more episodes but it was nice to see it animated and the characters were awesome to watch but that damn cliff-hanger ending that hints at another season...in 2017 (FUCK!!!!!) - 8/10


Characters: Basically the same as the old anime with a bit more development and whilst I dislike some characters most of the cast is as fun loving as usual. The anime also hints at a few blossoming relationships that may be ignited *Ahem* GALE *AHEM* - 8/10


Art: Whilst I thought that the three main arcs were animated beautifully (especially in the fight scenes) I found that the animation in the filler arc and filler episodes was kinda boring and lackluster which possibly showed cracks of a tighter budget - 7/10


Sound: Another beautiful soundtrack that pays homage to the original with some remixes of old tracks and some brand new ones that even show it up! The openings are still amazing with a mixture of slow, calm and serious vs rock, upbeat and fun ones. My personal favorites are opening 18, 21 & 22.

-DUB/SUB: I would have to say to watch the sub for now as the dub isn't completed yet. But both sides to a good job of voicing the characters in all of their glory but I would have to say that the Japanese voice actors do better in the more emotional parts of the serious but the dub (from what I've seen) does better in the comedic areas. - 9/10


Enjoyment: whilst it does have fan service in it and is kinda perverted at times (much like the manga) but it also is a fun-loving and competent adventure/action/drama/comedy narrative with a range of characters that will make you laugh, cry or scream :) - 8/10


Overall: Fairy Tail 2014 is a sequel done right and whilst it has a shaky start, the ending does not disappoint and I can't wait to see more of Natsu and the gang in the future. - 8/10

(Which is 2017 for the anime viewers...but I read the manga to!)

Okay, so we all know Fairy Tail is a classic anime. By that I mean, that it is an oldie, but a goodie. Overall I give it a 7, just because one of the arcs were really really bad. That, and a couple of other things.
Lets start with its art style: 6-7ish
Fairy Tail's animation in its 2014 continuation has improved simply due to technological improvements, making the fighting scenes more fluent.  However, solely based on its art, I am still not the biggest fan of it. I mean, sometimes I really feel like the character and costume designs are almost lazy, as if halfwaythrough the brainstorming stage, Hiro Mashima was just like: 'yeah whatevs this bikini and pop of colour is good enough.'

Not only that, but I mean, just search up this one character: Chapati Lolaand, and tell me that this isn't uninspired: . 

Who cares about side characters, amiright? Some people may disagree with me, but honestly, we all know there is better.  


Story: 7-8

Okay, so I absolutely love it. I get many feels from this series, but just putting my focus on 2014, I really don't like one of the arcs (Eclipse Celestial Spirits). Also I get annoyed that there is a constant reminder that: 'Fairy Tail is our guild! A FAMILY I SAY. NEVER GIVE UP BECAUSE WE IS FAMILY.' It is okay to mention every now and again, but really? AGAIN? It's the same message that they have said nearly every single battle. That being said, weirdly enough... it does tend to work more often than not.

Only of late, I really am enjoying it, and having read the manga ahead, I am happy to see that the anime follows it pretty well. It hits me in the feels.


Characters: 8

Well this is one of the reasons why I continue to watch this show. I am in love with all the characters and their determination and quirks. They have stayed the same which is great to see. Only there is one problem. I wish that they could grow even more than where they are now, (in which in the manga they do). Also my shipper heart just wishes that relationships can actually become canon in some cases. I understand this isn't a romance or shoujo anime, but I wouldn't mind seeing something blossom. In saying that, again, this keeps me 'nawwing' at particular scenes when something does happen.


Overall: 7

Fairy Tail has pretty much what you expect from it's original series as it follows the manga pretty on point. It still has those kind of scenes you would expect like 'never give up', and 'WE ARE Fairy Tail,' and has a lot of fillers that can be skipped (although some are really good). I'm certain that this anime will become better especially that they are in a pretty good place right now. So as much as I have bagged out this series, I wouldn't mind being a part of the Fairy Tail guild myself.

**THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS**
(I mean it's shounen, so who gives a crap ...) 
Hey! Remember that fun, light adventure anime with lots of humor, no bullshit recap, satisfying action, one liners and lots of badassery? Yeah, me too! So where the fuck did it disappear to? 
This review is written solely for people who've watched original series (but then again ... if you didn't watch the original, why the hell would you be looking this one up? damn man, you're weird) and will reference, what I consider to be, two halves of one Fairy Tale. Pun indented. 
Fairy Tail is somewhat of a guilty pleasureto me. It's an anime I'd oftentimes turn on just for laughs and chills and some Natsu badass moments. It's something you can always watch and relax. Sure, it had its "dramatic" moments, but they were extremely light. The anime knew what it was and never really tried being anything more. It was mindless fun and it was great as it was. So what in the flying flip of fucks happened? Where did the theme of light adventure go? Why are the fun characters replaced with brooding morons who spit out 'woe is me' lines more often than Bella from Twilight? Why the fuck do we have 8 minutes of recap each damn episode? Well, let's try and figure it out. Here's my theory on what happened: 


The writer of the Fairy Tail decided he'd like his next manga to be darker and more mature, but first decided to experiment his bullshit ideas on Fairy Tail. Well, he obviously fucked it up, and what was supposed to be a fun anime you can just randomly turn on to relax, switched into something so annoyingly boring you might as well re-watch 175 episodes of the first season, 20 of the 2nd, and leave the 60 to rot in hell where they belong. 


Villains in Fairy Tail were always cartoony and over the top. They were annoying, would spit bullshit left and right, but you were able to tolerate them mostly because they either looked cool or had cool magic or whatever. People like Jellal (please, just kill off this character; he's literally a walking depression at this point), Hades, Zero, etc.. They were all over the top, but hell, it was enjoyable seeing Natsu whoop their ass with some fire. But "villains" in the aftermath of Magic Games Arc (hell, even during it if we're being honest) are just flat out annoying. They're not intimidating, you don't really want to see them dead, you just want to see them gone because they annoy the crap out of you. The arc that the anime is currently in brings forth set of 9(10) new "villains" out of which LITERALLY 0 have any intimidating presence or cool magic. They're running joke. Unless this "END" bullshit demon turns out to be the coolest shit in the world, I'll literally call last 30 episodes of this anime the worst in its history (didn't read the manga, stopped a while ago). 


I still actually haven't touched on what really happened to the show, so here it is, brutal truth: Fairy Tail has always been a pussy-out type of a show, meaning that nobody dies. After a while you just kind of accept it and roll with it. This also meant that it underlined all the potential heartbreaking moments, but you weren't watching Fairy Tail for that shit. In addition, the anime was always about Fairy Tail kicking someone's butt, about hyping the newfound, random powers that came out of nowhere, but you dealt with it because that shit was cool. Here's the anime past Magic Games Arc (and somewhat during it): pussy-outs are everywhere. Characters "die" every 2 episodes, and each time they're supposed to "die", they are given about 10 minutes of sobbing and crying. Even when it so happens that it looks like 1 of them will die (not even a main character), turns out she won't die, Lucy just won't be able to summon her again. Everything is now dark, everything is about gloom, about revenge, about this, that and stuff Fairy Tail was never about. Author tries to make his story more "mature" and "epic", but fails to realize that we know he can't. He doesn't have balls to kill anyone off. Hell, he doesn't have balls to make Fairy Tail lose. We're talking about a dude who literally made an entire arc that lasted nearly 40 episodes just to bring a single character back to life. Remember that. 


Moving on from the story which is just a plothole shitfest even a 5 year old mentally challenged kid can dissect into pieces, let's talk about the characters. They're 1 of 3 reasons I liked Fairy Tail. There are a lot of them, and each has its own merits: Lucy is a straight man, Happy and Natsu are just Happy and Natsu, Erza is Erza, etc. Each character was fun on his/her own, but was also fun when set up against the others. So what the fuck happened? Gray is literally a walking flashback now. Each time this dude appears in the show, we get a flashback about something that happened in 10th episode of the 1st season. I swear, in the past 30 episodes, he had more flashback than in the arc that was MADE ABOUT HIM. You might as well pit him up with Jellal and have a walking disaster as they would make depression a virus that spreads faster than piss with the wind. Natsu turned into a fucking wuss. Dude gets beaten up left and right (during Giants arc or whatever, he gets beaten up with a dude wielding a fucking mechanical hand), has 1 relatively badass moment in 40 episodes (which was against a random flying thing or whatever; let that sink in. Actually, that might as well be called the most badass moment in the past 50 episodes. Against some random animal that had no tie-in to the story. Let that sink in) and offers nothing else. There's this scene during the last arc whereas he finds headquarters of this dark guild and busts in. You expect something like what happened with Sabertooth, for him to go badass mode and do something, but nope, he gets captured in like 10 seconds. You might as well rename Laxus into deus-ex-machina, Erza into "I'll beat you but first you need to whoop my ass for 20 minutes for no reason", Lucy into ... well, let's face it, she's always been bouncing boobs really. But hell, screw that; Lucy had the most badass moment of all during the arc against 9 demons of hell. Please, just think of that for a second. Just for a second. Lucy. A character who was literally made to be a fanservice cow. 


Speaking of fanservice, I want to give this anime some credit. In manga, there were a few scenes that were just brutally dumb, honest to Satan retarded, but anime managed to work them out somehow. Props to literally telling the mangaka "dude, like, this ain't no hentai bro, chill down". 


The only even remotely interesting character at the moment is Wendy. I mean, the little girl has her own badass moments here and there. Who would have thought, right? 


Humor is scarce nowadays in Fairy Tail. You'll encounter it a few times in the episode, while the rest is about either flashbacks, atonement for some random shit, speeches about how humans are weak, shit and rely too much on emotions, speeches about how that's what makes humans strong not week, pointless "I'll save everyone" speeches that literally overshadow any action. I swear to the sweet holy Satan, there hasn't been a single interesting fight in this anime that was actually exciting and looked cool visually since Natsu vs Two Dragon dudes. The closest this season came to having that was Natsu against random flying cat-looking thing. No, not even Natsu vs Rogue. It was about 90% speeches and repeated animations and about 10% anything remotely interesting. Not even Celestial King vs Underworld King. That in itself should scream awesome fight but nope. Not even Gray vs his dad (o yeah, get a load of this "amazing" storytelling here man, it'll shake the foundations of literature), nothing, zero. Even animation has somehow dulled from the last season. To this day, I still think that Natsu vs Zero had by far the best animation, followed closely by Natsu vs Jellal (and that shit was literally years ago). I don't know. I'm really close to just throwing my hands up in the air and saying "Fuck this shit". 


Music is still here though. It's good and you can easily listen it outside of anime and have good time, but that's about it. This anime literally turned into a random experiment because no one has a clue on what the fuck they're doing with this thing. Fairy Tail's world was never set out for serious storytelling, deep characters and exploration of humanity and humans. It was about fun, light adventure with decent one-liners and badass fights. What did it turn into? A walking mess of woe, characters acting like a five year old throwing a fit because you didn't buy her iPhone, and so many cop-outs, random power-ups and sudden "revelations" that it trumps over its previous season, Naruto and Bleach combined. Holy crap this is one hell of a mess. 


Anyway, if you're thinking about watching this, I'd rather just watch, what I call, "the Good half of Fairy Tail". Things kind of went astray after the 7 years speed-forward, but it still somewhat held it charm during the games. Now everything is just ... sigh ... whatever. Fuck this thing.

Minor spoilers btw
Ok, so for a while I've seen people around claim that fairy tail 2014 has ruined the fairy tail series as an anime. Well that may be true to some extent, saying that it's "ruined" imo is a BIG overstatement. Now I will admit that the the 2014 version is definitely a down grade from the old one. I'm not that nice. But I can arguably agree that the current one is still watchable and enjoyable to see if you are a fan of fairy tail.
Story (7): I'm not even going to mention the filler arc. We all know how atrocious that was.For continuing the canon story though, I say that fairy tail 2014 has done a decent job. The addition of the whole Lucy and Natsu witnessing the dragons terrorizing the town moments made the Grand Magic Games arc feel a little more darker than what it was made to seem in the manga. Plus, though its very minimal, there was blood. Even the current Tartaros arc that's airing now is being adapted pretty well. There is still a bit of moments in the plot where you can question whether it was are justifiable or not, but if your somebody like me you try not to make things like that such a big deal that it prevents you from watching a could be good show for yourself.


Art (5): I think this is what most people are having a problem with fairy tail 2014, and tbh, compared to what it was in the original anime...it sucks. That's only when you make an comparison though. There are plenty of scenes you can look up where the animation is good to the point where you could talk about it all night...but at the same time there are plenty of scenes half assed to the point that you wonder if the animators are even giving a damn about the show anymore. I can still argue that out of all the long running shounen anime that has aired back then and is currently airing right now, fairy tail overall still beats the other series by a good amount in terms of animation.


Sound (7): It's still pretty good. Heck, I would download the whole soundtrack if I could. However comapared to the old ost which literally made people have eargasms 24/7, it probably will never beat it.


Character (7): I'm not the one to be so upset when someone hates on a character. It's only when the excuse to hate on the character becomes so cliché where you can't help but cringe everytime you hear it. And I'm afraid that is what happened to almost the entire cast of fairy tail. Now, what is the cliché excuse you ask? It's not the fact that Natsu is "typical", it's not the fact that Lucy and Gray are "only used for fanservice", and it's not because all of Erza's fights are "complete bullshit". I think some of you are realizing what I'm getting at...I'm talking about how they apparently "don't have any character development". I don't want to get too deep with this topic because I don't really want this review to be too long. , but it just irritates me when I ask somebody why they hate Natsu or why they hate Lucy, and all they reply is with "oh, they don't have any character development". First of all, if you still think these characters don't have a single drop of development even after 6 years worth of airing this show, I seriously suggest that you go watch from the begnning again or else your probably on something. Character development shouldn't be something that makes a character for you, it should be something that makes the character better. Personality-wise and as PEOPLE, Natsu, Lucy, Gray, Erza, you name it, ALMOST everybody in the show has something to love about them and hate about them. Could they use more depth? Of course. LOL, Did you think I was calling these characters masterpieces? I would love for everything in fairy tail to not go so well for them all the time. I even sometimes forget if anything ever really bad happened in their lives. Although, that shouldn't make them necessarily downright terrible.


Enjoyment (6): Unfortunately with the disappointment in production quality, fairy tail has sometimes been a chore to watch rather than me being on my toes waiting for next week's release. I can finish an episode saying "Wow! That was really good!" or "Meh, felt like I wasted my time on that one."


Overall (6): Where as to I gave the previous series an 8, I give this one a 6. It might change after this current arc.


 So yeah, short review. I was more trying to express a positive opinion toward the show I guess.

This was de first big anime that I saw, and definitely deserves a review.
This is a comedy, action, adventure and fantasy anime, where we learn the true value of friendship, never giving up on our goals or doubting our abilities.
I have no heart after this anime ... It's such a good anime that it's a shame not to have continued, despite the fact that exists ovas that are coming out. (But it doesn't matter, the anime should be eternal!)
Of course the romance could have been more explored ... But even with very little romance, the anime remains perfect! Highly recommend it very much.
It's an animewhere information "fits" all. And, one thing that I love in Fairy Tail is that the characters do not disappear. All characters appear more than once in the anime. Besides that when a character does not appear for a long time, the anime gives a brief summary about where the same person appeared in the past!

I have seen many anime so far , many of which are considered blockbusters. But if Fairy Tail (as well as the first season) is not the best series (or at least among them) , then I don't know what is.
I rarely cry or get touched by anime. But Fairy Tail (and mainly the 2nd season) was really moving. As for the last episodes , I have to admit that I was really touched to the point of crying.
Where should I even begin from?
-Sound? :  Both Openings&Endings and OSTs are outstanding.For me , Fairy Tail alongside with Naruto have the best collection of OSTsI have heard so far.


-Art? :  Well , all the characters and landscapes are so well drawn , with such detail. 


As for the story : Complicated but at the same time easy-to-understand plot. Very interesting and well-processed story with a lot of references to the past.


But what I love most about this anime is the characters  and the bonds the form with each other. Each one of them have their own strenghts and flows , their own drear pasts , but by overcoming hardships they move on. They  highlight the meaning of friendship and the meaning of "comrades" and "guild" , and they remind us that even if you have fallen into darkness , you can always find the strength and start again.


All in all , it is an anime I firmly recommend to any of you . 


Usually when I write a review I write some other animes that could be related to this , but in this case , I don't think that there is anything that could be compared to Fairy Tail.

My goal since freshman year was the finish all the popular shonen's before I graduate. I've seen many anime's such as One Piece, Bleach, Naruto, Hunter x Hunter, Death Note, ect. I watched Fairy Tail solely because I had just finished Naruto and I thought it would be fitting. At first glance most would think that Fairy Tail is a kid show with a lot of Fanservice. My best friend is convinced that Fairy Tail is crap, mostly because of the things he's heard on the Internet. See for those of who have watched Fairy Tail and hated it because of it's story while thereis no coherent plot line, The beauty of Fairy Tail is all in the adventure. Yes it's very repetitive (But so was the early seasons of One Piece). The minute you stop comparing it to other anime's is when you can fully enjoy Fairy Tail. Fairy Tail is by no means a perfect anime. Hell out of the big 4 anime it's probably the worst one. But even if it's the worst it is still pretty darn good.


Story:

Don't let anybody fool you. The main character is Natsu. While all the character's have specific goals, a problem always arises and it distracts them from their goals. The thing that separates this from most other shonen is that while their goal's are important to them. They put their family (the guild) first before themselves. The show is all about Friendship triumphs all, and if that bothers you then you shouldn't be watching shonen. The story is not perfect, not by a long shot but Fairy Tail still gives you a lot of fun watching battles, the character interactions, and even the romance. 


Art & Sound: I am honestly not one to look at the art, it never really affected my love for a show. However the sound. I love the Fairy Tail soundtrack, it has some pretty good OP's *cough cough* Snow Fairy *Cough cough* 


Character's:

The thing about this show that bother's me is that the entire show isn't trying to develop Natsu, they are developing Lucy. Lucy has gone from a weak celestial wizard to actually fighting her own battles and standing (Somewhat) of a chance. But even then we still don't know much about Lucy. We only know a little bit of the character's backstory. But I find most of the character's fun and lovable (I hate Lucy in the first 2 seasons but now I love her)


Enjoyment & Overall

This show is by no means a One Piece, or a Naruto. No matter how hard it try it will just never be. I feel that Fairy Tail has a lot more potential to be a better anime. The story telling could be better. The best arc hands down so far has be the Tartarus arc, and that was just the current arc. For those of you who are considering watching it, it really depends on the type of person you are. If you are someone who compare's anime's you will not enjoy it as much as someone who watches it with an open mind. Fairy Tail is not for everyone. But if you enjoyed One Piece then you will enjoy Fairy Tail. I gave the series an 8/10. because I love the story, I love the character's however I feel theres a lot more potential in the series.

The Father who is always on a trip,
The mothers who all Suffer from the dead mother Cliché,
The Brother and Sister in law who once were sworn Enemies but now have the hots for 2 of the Family,
the Bunch of Siblings who are always there just to be there,
The brother/Sister in law who just Joined the Family and is pretty much not Insane like the rest
and not to forget their Smart ass Cats............
WaitDoesn't That sound a bit Dysfunctional?

Yes it does and that is what Fairy tail is as a show.


This review will cover both the first and second Anime and the manga bdw. 


Friendship and Family are Wonderfull and will give you all the Support, Fun, Comfort and etc.

but in the World of fairy tail it also Gives you Hax powers somehow.

yup it is the tired "Power of friendship Cliché" all over again with the whole show and that is pretty much evident in each fight. in most fights fights, it's always one sided slaughter until the word Friendship gets mentionned, making most fights end up being anticlimactic.

only a very few times was Strategy used, like in the Final battle in the Manga for example. 

Which is pretty sad since the Concept of Magic in FT has unlimited potential (but that is mostly because it had no skill ceiling) and had some cool ideas like the Unison Raid where 2 Mages could combine their powers to unleash a Powerful attack, Celestial Spirits who will help the Celestial Wizard who holds their key and other powers.

one good thing however is that the Soundtrack is really a Blast to hear, especially the Dragonslayer Theme is just so good at making you all Fired up, and that track is the one you will hear in most fights thus making them Bearable thanks to the awesome Music.


But the fights are not the only thing that ended up getting Screwed up, ohohoho yes The rest of the show is also poorly done.


The story actually started off Fairy well, The very first Chapters/episodes where quite Fun to be honest. The jokes were Funny and the whole feel of the show was just brimming with wonder and energy which made me like the series. yh they weren't exactly that well written but it was quite a bit of fun Until Edolas arc reared its ugly head.

yh the arcs before that weren't that good but the show took a nosedive in Quality after that arc began.

but in order to begin talking about what really infuriated me about that arc, I first have to talk about the Characters.


Aside from the fact that most of the Characters are Members of Fairy tail, The Characters are pretty basic to begin with,

you have the typica shounen hothead Natsu who is also a Dragonslayer, Eats huge amounts of food, loves to fight and talks all about Friendship. Soundds like a typical shounen lead right? Right and Typical shounen leads also have a Rival so here comes

Gray, who often gets into fights with Natsu just for Comedic Relief (Yh the series never took their Rivalry serious like Naruto did), He is an Ice Maker (and Ice Demon Slayer later on) who also seems to be a professional stripper (so good that a certain girls gets wet from it) and a Dancer who can kick Micheal Jackson's ass on the dance-floor somehow.

but who can stop their Freindly rivalry? Erza Scarlet ofcourse with her Stern attitude, she makes the rest of the Fairy tail Guild her Bitch since she is the Woman in the house who will kick others ases if they don't behave and etc etc etc.

Lucy however is probably the most Sane of the 7 main Characters (yh 7 main Characters) and the rest of the guild. She always points out the idiocrasy of the other Characters. However she also wears pretty Brave Clothing (if you know what I mean).

and then there is the innocent Child Named Wendy, who is the sweetheart of the Group because she is basically the Healer of the Group and we must always respect the Healer hey?

But hey a group is not complete without Cats! introducing Happy, The annoying smartass blue Tomcat of natsu and Carla (YES I GO WITH THE DUB NAMES SCREW YOU DUB HATERS) Who is pretty much an strict and straight Ice queen.

That is pretty much the Main group called team Natsu.


There are so many other Characters but naming them all here would result into me being a Skeleton behind the keyboard so here are some of the short descriptions of the Characters and it is up to you to know who they are

There is: the sexy alchoholic, a literally wet girl, a Demonic Model, The overly Manly man, the Gramps, Shikamaru, Shanks, Ichigo and many many more.


So what is the issue with the Characters then? well to put it simply with 3 main issues:

1, They hardly Develop but maybe if they are lucky they will get Development at one point only to be stale for the rest of the show. this causes the Characters to only become more annoying and boring as the series goes on.

2, The Villains are also veeery one note and anto climactic mostly because they lack any depth and get defeated by the power of friendship. they just go "Mwahahaha I am evil so i do evil Things together with my lackies who are just there for characters to fight with before they fight me!", even the 2 biggest main villains Xerath and agnologia suffer from this despite the Hype around them being huge.

3, The Characters abuse the power of Friendship and are Plot armored so much that can even cheat death.


and that Cheating death is the biggest issue in the Edolas arc that also ended up forcing a retcon, Why? because the Character who was not dead was ectually dead at the beginning of the series so it had to be retconned into him/her being missing instead.


the whole Story of FT is also constantly repeating itself, an Evil Villain group does evil things and Fairy tail must fight them. that is basically what each arc is except for the Grand Magic games arc that was different only to return into the same thing all over again.

And that is by far the biggest problem with Fairy tail.

it never Changes/ adds spice to its plot, resulting in the show becoming Boring.


However, Sometimes an Omake comes out, and they are pretty much the most enjoyable

part of Fairy tail. they are pretty much not the same as thing as the other arcs and are really funny. in other words these kind of Chapters/episodes that are just straight up Comedy are the best parts of the show.


but these kind of episodes are just far to few of sadly.


So to sum it all up, The series suffers so much from Repetition that the issues like Plot armor and etc only became worse and worse, making it harder for me to watch.


And to be honest, I watched it with joy at first but sadly, now I just don't like it anymore after a while.

Boy, oh, boy. What a ride this show has given me. It's been 4 years since I began the journey of watching this incredible show---from the start of Lucy's initiation into the guild, Fairy Tail, to the end of the second season of this incredible show. Despite myself slowly moving away from anime shows; this one I had to complete. And so, I'm here, writing this review for everyone out there to read, and understand why this show is worth finishing till the very end. 
Story: 7/10: 
The world of Fairy Tail is very intriguing. It makes it seem so alive, so rich, yet simplein a typical magical, medieval fantasy world. Sure, its story is above average at best (if you're solely judging the frequency/cliches/uniqueness), but its meaning and journey that YOU, the viewers, follow enriches the experience even more so. At times, it does fall in its attempt to fully attract the eyes of myself, hence why I delayed watching the end of this season for over a year. Despite this, however, I was quite pleasantly surprise on the lore of the universe and what it had to reveal. Especially this season, it's so chilling, yet very awesome to see! Although, the first season had better arcs, the Tartaros one is extremely well-worth to watch. Probably one of the best ones so far.



Art: 8/10:


The studio does a superb job at remastering the drawings to look more refined and smooth. Although, the color palette did abruptly switch during the beginning of an arc to a more 'mature' like tone, but I was still impressed with how beautiful the world looked. Its animations, and design of certain characters (both refreshing and new) made me want to say, "Wow! That person looks dope AF!!!". 


Though, I do have to point out that the designs for the female characters (especially the ones with the big boobs) are really annoying. I dislike the constant boobies that the animators keep throwing in our faces. Just want to see cool looking armor, y'know? 


Sound: 10/10: 


I cannot even count how many times I received goosebumps/chills all over my body when a song from the OP/ED or theme song began playing. Every time there was a fight, my skin began to tremble in excitement as the song progressed. For the other sounds/audio, the places of towns, nature, and crowds were extremely well-done. It made the immersion a lot more rich, and I was able to enjoy it 10x more. It felt amazing reminiscing the old opening songs from the first season, and I thoroughly was impressed in the improvement of the songs. 



Character: 7/10: 


To be honest, the character development in the beginning of the second season is somewhat confusing. At times, it feels like the characters just don't even grow or feel so bland. That is, until you reach half-way (around the 50 episode mark) is when the background and the growth of characters begins to kick in. That's when you truly feel like, "Holy shit, he/she is so badass now.". In terms of relatable, and interesting characters, I'd say there is only like 1-2 really. [lol] 

You've got OP Natsu, OP Erza, OP Gray, and OP everyone else, which really just makes it kinda question if you should just continue or not because of how ridiculous the protagonists are. 


The villains in this show are mixed. Some are good, and some are just out-right terrible. You'll get really angry when you hear typical evil villains repeat, "It's over, surrender now", or "Oh, my how did you get so strong???" 


Same with the main characters sometimes. (I'm looking at you Lucy) 


Enjoyment: 10/10:


I loved the meaning of this show and what it stands for. 

"The Power of Friendship"

"Standing together makes you stronger than standing alone"

"Friendship can be like a family"

"Blood doesn't always mean family"

"etc"

The scenes of the show, the comedy that is inserted at awkward times, I really enjoyed. Sure, it takes away of the seriousness of the story and all, but at the same time, it makes sense for these characters. They always seem to be serious when needed, and at times, their personality shines at the darkest hour. 


Overall: 10/10:


What a damn good show. Sure, it has some really flaws that can be turn-offs at some points, but overall, if you just watch the show to make a connection with the characters, and truly (I mean this seriously) enjoy the story, you'll definitely find the journey to the end fulfilling. It makes you wonder about your life sometimes, and how adventure, hardships, and life itself challenges you in various ways. 


TL;DR: If you enjoy getting goosebumps, love to laugh at serious moments, want to invest your time into a decent story, love having a great time, and most importantly, likes to see great fights between the MCs and Villains (Also bewbs if you're into that), then you should watch this show.

First things first. My "reviews" system is explained on a blog entry. Which can be found through my profile.
------
Self-note: Maybe revise some stuff later on for a bit extra clarity.
✦Story
Well, the main/serious story part of "Fairy Tail 2014" is quite good. A lot of great fights, new power elements and their method of surfacing. But main Issue with the story I have is main reason I probably put it on hold. And that would be how non-sensical and disappointing turnarounds happened. It's extremely light hearted good and evil battle shounen. But such straightforwardness  made it a bit disappointing considering how well this Anime managedto create really desperate and emotional situations. But nevertheless story managed to make me emotional quite often even at most silly moments. To sum it up story is an extremely powerful regarding friendships and bonds. Very powerful and beautiful friendships and it prevailing against all odds.


As well we have more humorous and service filled story act. Which in most part is quite enjoyable, but lack of progression makes them a bit dull. Especially when the main story character strength/growth rarely moves forward as well.  Another thing regarding that reminded me of how much frustration this Anime gave me before I put it on hold. Where a simple reason was that the fights were quite self repeating in not a good way. Whenever they gave you new power or moment of "power scale has risen once again". Somehow, next moment it's forgotten and thus being stuck in such a loop made it a tad bit annoying.


Other than that. There is fair bit of tragedy in the story and twists.


But in the end, main story is quite enjoyable and emotional. The world and thematics are pleasant and fun, whereas the whole thing is very light-hearted. It simply didn't amaze me as it used to.


✦Art & Sound

First of all. Music in this Anime is amazing as always. Also the tavern like music of Guilds is also very merry-go-round, powerful and fun.


As for art and animation. It's good as always. Very impressive magic fights, character designs, creatures and so on. 


✦Character

A lot of stereotypes and a lot of lovable characters. Their growth is a bit odd, but I did get attached to them. Past is for the most part quite tragic.


✦Overall & Enjoyment

I pretty much said everything I wanted but can add few things.


One thing regarding Fairy Tail I love, is the fan-service. It feels extremely "natural" and pleasant, which is probably how the world itself reacts, presents and interacts with a lot of fan-serice moments in this Anime, which makes it fairly pleasant. There are different types of fan-service there for me. Those that are simply there, but are so irrelevant and non-interesting that you just forget it's existence. Those that force sexual service and ruins the experience. Those that have service and are sexually inviting, which can enhance the experience. And those that have fan-serice, but are so oddly "natural" that it's pleasant to see, but you don't really get "seduced" by it in dirtier manner. Fairy Tail belongs best to the last type. There are few itsy bitsy "types" more I could categorize, but I simply wanted to give an example.


Another thing I can mention that "Fairy Tail Zero a.k.a last 10 episodes or so of this season", was extremely nice touche. I do love Mavis. Which also gave few answers and another dose of tragedy with a taste of odd nostalgia.  On top that how main story got wrapped up pre-zero arc, especially the post-credit. Gave me basically the following clump of emotional reaction "why?...noo please...f you"


I find it extremely difficult to review 2014 fairy tail. One reason would be that when I first watched Fairy Tail first season, I found it extremely enjoyable battle shounen for all sorts of reasons. Now that years passed and I picked up 2014 series, I got oddly tired and exhausted of it quite fast. Whenever I've "outgrown" it or simply have become more depressed I do not know. But moral of the story is that I enjoyed it overall a lot less than the first series, but it still remains good.


Want happy-go-lucky emotional ride of powerful and beautiful friendships and bonds with spice of tragedy, straightforwardness and strawberry a the top being service, battle shounen Anime? Then it's definitely a good watch.


Not that good, if you want a battle-shounen with more serious and powerful awakenings and breakthroughs.

So, I'm writing this review as a person who loves Fairy Tail.
Whenever someone asks for a recommendation of a longer anime, I always say Fairy Tail first.
So for those of you who have heard of Fairy Tail, you have probably heard of some negative comments about this anime/manga. I have heard people complain about FT being too similar to other mainstreams, or the story is random... etc.
And I agree to some degree. However, I see this as a positive thing rather than a complaint.
Mashima has already responded that part of this work was inspired by One Piece (also an amazing anime). There is nothing wrongwith that. There is no way an anime can be 100% original. "Oh this anime has a character with orange hair, therefore it was copied from Bleach" NO. You're being too picky.\n\n
However, it is a very original and unique storyline. For people who only start a bit of Fairy Tail will most likely be confused or say the plot is random, and it may seem so if you only saw parts of it. But this is one of the few over-200-episodes animes that have smaller arcs in the story as a whole, AND works out perfectly. I say this because no matter how many details are mentioned, it always turns out to be somewhat important in the end. \n\n
As a summary, all I'm saying is give it a chance. For people who are new to this series, you may find it a waste of time because it is long. But it is definitely worth it once you get further into it and realize all of the details mentioned earlier are very significant. And to those who have watched a good amount and are still unhappy with this, you can definitely have your opinion. But it's a long story because every bit of the plot is so detailed it can't be explained in one chapter. So I definitely recommend Fairy Tail.

GENERAL - Note: I will not cover anything from the previous Fairy Tail run this will only focus on the (2014) series.
So 2014 starts right where the first run left off. At this point in the arc it starts to become more and more interesting and picks up its pace. Right from episode 1 of the 2014 run we already start to get a very interesting start to the later half of the arc and is where Fairy Tail starts to pick up.
Fairy Tail 2014 puts  its focus on only a few arcs. This can be good although due to this it doesn't feelike as much has been done in the story with only several arcs int he run. One of which is filler.


2014's filler arc is  not very good. The start of it is okay but then drags out and becomes a pain to watch at times. I would suggest skipping this filler arc.


We continue on with our next major arc which is the  turning point in the series and is where Fairy Tail becomes realllly interesting and good. We continue to learn more about Zeref and our other villains and  in so many of the episodes its just dropping information on us that we have wnated to know for ages and starts to pull the story together.


We get a back story arc for the guild which is one of the best written arcs in Fairy Tail and is very enjoyable to watch. While it does not directly connect to the currret story arc it is used to fill in the gap between arcs but does not coem off as filler material as it is part of the story itself.


CHARACTERS - So  2014 is used mainly for character development. At this point our main cast is here and the rest of the 2014 series helps  by fleshing out these characters and giving them more depth.


SOUND - THe sound of Fairy Tail is in general just as great as ever. There aren't as many soundtracks and I do miss some of the old OST's but the music still fits the series very well.


ART / ANIMATION - So in 2014 the art style changes to be more like the manga. This isn't a bad thing but when this was being done it seemed like the animation itself  went down hill.  Quite often there will be just still images.



OVERALL - While 2014 does nto complete the series still it continues to progress the story in a big way. And I feel its a very good thing that it took a break since we do nto want more filler like this past filler arc. Even though we do not receive as many arcs there are still plenty of key plot points to make u for this.


SCORE -8.8

PERSONAL ENJOYMENT - 10

I rate longer shows by arc, if possible.  Here are the numbers; more detailed explanation below, though I warn you I shy away from specifics.
Grand Magic Games/Eclipse: 8
Eclipse Celestial Spirits: 5
Sun Village: 8
Tartaros: 8
Zero: 7
Avatar: 5
Continuing from the first season, which cuts off part-way through the Grand Magic Games arc, Fairy Tail takes an impressive step forward, breaking through its rehashed faults (for the most part) to create a thoroughly captivating arc- segue culminating in one of the most powerful moments in the entire series, contested only by the Tartaros arc.
Unfortunately, the series quickly falls back to its old ways with the mediocre EclipseSpirits arc, but the interest quickly builds again with the highly underrated Sun Village arc, which very effectively paves the way for what the creators intended to be the climactic arc of the entire series: Tartaros.\n\n
The Tartaros arc does indeed deliver.  Our main characters each have a long-standing antagonistic issue settled in quite satisfying ways.  However, it ends with the watcher wanting more due to its heavily cliff-hanger-esque ending.  It's similar to the feeling in Pokemon after you beat the last Elite 4 member, only to discover that there's one more challenger in your way.  But then the game ends without even giving you a chance to fight him.  That's how Fairy Tail feels, but I will admit that it is done in a clever fashion: by swerving and backtracking to the beginning with the Zero arc.\n\n
The Zero arc has a lot it has to deliver; it would be a massive disappointment if it was filler.  It does deliver, and in a quite unexpected fashion, by linking forgotten ends together and allowing us to be content with the established antagonism created at the end of Tartaros evaporating.\n\n
The short Avatar arc which ends the series was inevitably a disappointment, since the developers wanted to end on a cliff.  Props to them for ending the show in the most unsatisfying way possible, but still in an acceptable manner.\n\n
Overall, the second season has greater highlights and less swampy arcs to trudge through to get to the good stuff.  It was a struggle at some points, and I took multiple long interims during the unimportant arcs, but it was worth watching all 272 episodes (even though I went through some arcs like Key and ECS at 2x the speed on Youtube)

I've already watched and reviewed the previous Fairy Tail series. So if you're interested in that, check out my review! I thought it was a great anime all in all.
Fairy Tail (2014) was pretty much the same as the original anime series except it got dark. I mentioned in my other review that I really enjoy light series; nothing too dark, too much to think about, but the Tartaros Chapter was really different. The characters were - of course - still the same, but the plot was something I needed to adjust to. Sometimes I felt like I just really wanted to skip watching andget to the end because it never ended! I felt like right when the plot was advancing one step forward, it ended up taking four steps back! But there were definitely points in the arc that really pulled on my heartstrings - especially with Lucy and the celestial spirits. There was also so much that you learned about Natsu - character developments - that (unfortunately) hasn't been revealed yet. But it really gives you the want to continue watching it till the end of the anime (2018!). Other than the darker sense of atmosphere, mostly every stayed the same, as I previously stated.


Fairy Tail ZERO (arc?) was a pretty good one too. Most people suggested that it's a filter, but I definitely don't think so. It really begins a new story line - or rather - new life into the anime and where you think it will end up going. It's definitely worth the watch.


I still overall really love this anime - even this second series (which, btw, continued the story of the original series). It still gave me intense feelings as I watched fight scenes. It's actually rather surprising too that at some times, it felt like they would lose - or literally be on the urge of defeat - but don't! Which that of course is because it's a shonen - something that I feel like people are forgetting and because of it, disliking the fact that the good guys always win? Haha.


This is still a definitely recommended watch if you watched Fairy Tail in the past and want to continue and finish the series!

I think that the first round of fairy tail was alright--- the characters were fine, the plot was ok, but there was still excessive amounts of plot armor and fan service which clouded the significance of this anime. When I found out that they made more episodes, I was like "ok, maybe they will make it better than the first season" but boy was I wrong. I had to drop this anime after its embarrassing "Tartaros Arc" which is just an explosion of cliched anime and insignificant fillers. It physically hurt me to watch this part because they would literally take one fight scene andmanage to stretch it to five episodes, and they try to reel you in with extremely cliched plot progressions? I'm sorry but this anime is probably one of my biggest regrets and I invested too much time into this series when I could have been watching something better.\n
The only thing that was genuinely enjoyable about the series was the art. However, the fight scenes were quite bland and repetitive and it got really boring really fast. The whole "power of friendship" concept just put on an extra layer of disappointment in many situations. I was really expecting more from this but then again I was also prepared for unsatisfactory results. I used to be an avid fairy tail fan, hell, i used to recommend it to my friends. I started getting increasingly upset though as they threw out weekly episodes of complete trash and I could have skipped the episode and still had the same amount of intel about the plot. It's very messy and downright cringe-worthy in many aspects. I think that fairy tail /could/ have been a great series and there was a lot of opportunity and possibilities to make it nice, but it was just butchered. I'm sorry to all of the fans of fairy tail (i used to be one), but there are so many more shows worth watching than this. If you are thinking about watching this, just be prepared for a lackluster experience if you are knowledgable in what makes an anime good.

I'm a hardcore Fairy Tail fan, and I've noticed numerous people giving horrible ratings to Fairy Tail. I don't mind since it's your opinion, and I have no right to tell you that you're wrong. 
The only drastic change I saw in this sequel was the art. The art style changed, but to me, that's it. 
I've noticed that there hasn't been much character development, unfortunately. But still, please watch! Don't let these negative reviews put you down. Actually, well, saying that it's quite slow-paced -- but it has a good plot. You just have to be patient, and wait through it. The plot shalleventually come, and you'll get interested in it.\n
(Though if you want to go deeper into the plot, read the manga.)\n
Anyhow, the point is, I still enjoy this very much. I don't think it's "trash" or "just for money." I mean, have you ever been a manga-artist? I'm sure that not all these manga-artists do this just for money. Some artists actually want the viewers to enjoy. So please, don't get discouraged and watch it!\n
(For more motivation, I'll tell you this -- I binge-watched the whole thing.)

(I try to keep my reviews short and sweet and straight to the point without giving away spoilers with that said lets get this show on the road)
The Fairy Tail series is undoubtedly one of the most popular one however it lacks certain characteristics. 
Story line- This anime has the basic good versus evil aspect however that's all. Each episode is just one huge fight after another which became so predictable and boring. 
Art & Sound - both are decent.
Character- There was zero character development. They would often do flashbacks to create clear understandings of a characters actions. However, they failed to build a characterup. Each character kind of stayed in 

time with no advancement. BORING


Enjoyment- I generally enjoyed this anime. I watched to pass the time however it was nothing gut wrenching. It quickly came and left.


Overall - I really did enjoy watching this anime. Nonetheless when analyze it  lacks character progression. A plot that both motivates and create emotions within the viewer. I personally like to connect with an anime. However I found myself mindlessly watching it.
